triples.name: Hypergraph
triples.relevance: Hypergraphs are the central mathematical structure that the survey analyzes for modeling group interactions beyond pairwise relationships.

triples.name: Collaborative network
triples.relevance: Collaboration networks are a key application domain where hypergraphs naturally model group interactions with three or more participants.

triples.name: Null model
triples.relevance: Null models are a primary tool category in hypergraph mining for testing the statistical significance of observed patterns.

triples.name: Structure mining
triples.relevance: Structure mining provides the foundational techniques for extracting and analyzing structural patterns from hypergraphs.

triples.name: Transitivity (mathematics)
triples.relevance: Transitivity is a structural quantity used to compute and measure hypergraph properties and patterns.

triples.name: Complex network
triples.relevance: Complex networks and their topological features form a foundational framework for understanding hypergraph structures as higher-order networks.

triples.name: Network motif
triples.relevance: Network motifs represent recurring structural patterns that are analyzed in hypergraph mining as substructures like triangles.
